Package com.bitnic.bitnicorm

Class Configure

java.lang.Object
com.bitnic.bitnicorm.Configure
All Implemented Interfaces:
ISession, Closeable, AutoCloseable
public class Configure extends Object implements ISession
Root type for working with ORM

  • Constructor Details

    • Configure

      public Configure(String dataBaseName, int version, android.content.Context context)
      Configuration initialization, called once at application startup, creates the database file if it does not exist
      Parameters:
      dataBaseName - dataBaseName database file name with full path
      version - database file version
      context - context App 
                           
                      try {
                        new Configure("db.sqlite",3,appContext);
                      } catch (Exception e) {
                         throw new RuntimeException(e);
                      }

    • Configure

      public Configure(String dataBaseName, int version, android.content.Context context, List<Class> classList, boolean isWriteLog)
      Configuration initialization, called once at application startup, creates the database file if it does not exist
      Parameters:
      dataBaseName - database file name with full path
      version - database file version
      context - context App
      classList - list of DTO types, upon initialization, tables are automatically created based on the type if the table does not exist
      isWriteLog - force logging, only for debugging the application 
                           
                      List<Class> classList=new ArrayList<>();
                      classList.add(MyTable.class);
                      try {
                        new Configure("db.sqlite",3,appContext,classList,true);
                      } catch (Exception e) {
                         throw new RuntimeException(e);
                      }

    • Configure

      public Configure(String dataBaseName, int version, android.content.Context context, boolean isWriteLog)
      Configuration initialization, called once at application startup, creates the database file if it does not exist
      Parameters:
      dataBaseName - database file name with full path
      version - database file version
      context - context App
      isWriteLog - force logging, only for debugging the application 
                           
                     try {
                       new Configure("db.sqlite",3,appContext,true);
                     } catch (Exception e) {
                      throw new RuntimeException(e);
                     }

      Parameters:
      aClass - Instances of the represent classes and interfaces in a running Java application. This class must be annotated with the @MapTable or @MapTableName annotation, have a public parameterless constructor, and a public field marked with the primary key annotation.
      Returns:
      total number of records in the table

    • count

      public <T> int count(@NonNull Class<T> aClass, String where, Object... objects)
      Description copied from interface: ISession
      Gets the number of rows in a table, based on a condition
      Specified by:
      count in interface ISession
      Type Parameters:
      T - The generic type must represent a class marked with the annotation @MapTable or @MapTableName
      Parameters:
      aClass - Instances of the represent classes and interfaces in a running Java application. This class must be annotated with the @MapTable or @MapTableName annotation, have a public parameterless constructor, and a public field marked with the primary key annotation.
      where - A fragment of a SQL query script from a condition, where the condition, the word where, need not be written, string parameters are replaced with the parameter substitution character `?`, and parameter values are entered into the object collection in the order they appear in the query.
      objects - A collection of objects that replace the `?` symbols in a script, the order of the objects matches the order of the `?` symbols. A collection of objects that replace the `?` symbols in a script, the order of the objects matches the order of the `?` symbols.
      Returns:
      number of records in a table with selection condition

    • any

      public <T> boolean any(@NonNull Class<T> aClass)
      Description copied from interface: ISession
      Checks if rows exist in a table
      Specified by:
      any in interface ISession
      Type Parameters:
      T - The generic type must represent a class marked with the annotation @MapTable or @MapTableName
      Parameters:
      aClass - Instances of the represent classes and interfaces in a running Java application. This class must be annotated with the @MapTable or @MapTableName annotation, have a public parameterless constructor, and a public field marked with the primary key annotation.
      Returns:
      true not Empty table, false - Empty table 
       
 ISession session=Configure.getSession();
 session.deleteRows(SimpleTable.class);
 for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
     session.insert(new SimpleTable("name:"+i));
 }
 var res=session.any(SimpleTable.class);
 assertEquals(true,res);
 var res2=session.any(SimpleTable.class,"name=?","simple");
 assertEquals(false,res2);

    • any

      public <T> boolean any(@NonNull Class<T> aClass, String where, Object... objects)
      Description copied from interface: ISession
      Checks if rows exist in a table based on a condition
      Specified by:
      any in interface ISession
      Type Parameters:
      T - The generic type must represent a class marked with the annotation @MapTable or @MapTableName
      Parameters:
      aClass - Instances of the represent classes and interfaces in a running Java application. This class must be annotated with the @MapTable or @MapTableName annotation, have a public parameterless constructor, and a public field marked with the primary key annotation.
      where - A fragment of a SQL query script from a condition, where the condition, the word where, need not be written, string parameters are replaced with the parameter substitution character `?`, and parameter values are entered into the object collection in the order they appear in the query.
      objects - A collection of objects that replace the `?` symbols in a script, the order of the objects matches the order of the `?` symbols.
      Returns:
      true - there are records, false - no entries 
       
 ISession session=Configure.getSession();
 session.deleteRows(SimpleTable.class);
 for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
     session.insert(new SimpleTable("name:"+i));
 }
 var res=session.any(SimpleTable.class);
 assertEquals(true,res);
 var res2=session.any(SimpleTable.class,"name=?","simple");
 assertEquals(false,res2);

    • update

      public <T> int update(@NonNull T item)
      Description copied from interface: ISession
      Convenience method for updating rows in the database.
      Specified by:
      update in interface ISession
      Type Parameters:
      T - The generic type must represent a class marked with the annotation @MapTable or @MapTableName
      Parameters:
      item - An object, class type must be marked with annotation @MapTable or @MapTableName
      Returns:
      1-success , 0 - not success 
       
 @MapTable
 public class SimpleTable {
     public SimpleTable(){}
     public SimpleTable(String name){
         this.myName = name;
     }
     @MapPrimaryKey
     public long id;
     @MapColumnName("name")
     public String myName;
 }
 ISession session=Configure.getSession();
 session.insert(new SimpleTable("name"));
 var o=session.firstOrDefault(SimpleTable.class,null);
 o.myName="newName";
 var res=session.update(o);

 }

 var o=session.firstOrDefault(SimpleTable.class,null);
 o.myName="newName";

    • updateRows

      public <T> int updateRows(@NonNull Class<T> aClass, @NonNull PairColumnValue columnValues, String where, Object... objects)
      Description copied from interface: ISession
      Updating rows in a database based on a condition without loading rows on the client
      Specified by:
      updateRows in interface ISession
      Type Parameters:
      T - The generic type must represent a class marked with the annotation @MapTable or @MapTableName
      Parameters:
      aClass - Instances of the represent classes and interfaces in a running Java application. This class must be annotated with the @MapTable or @MapTableName annotation, have a public parameterless constructor, and a public field marked with the primary key annotation.
      columnValues - objects of type PairColumnValue
      where - A fragment of a SQL query script from a condition, where the condition, the word where, need not be written, string parameters are replaced with the parameter substitution character `?`, and parameter values are entered into the object collection in the order they appear in the query.
      objects - A collection of objects that replace the `?` symbols in a script, the order of the objects matches the order of the `?` symbols.
      Returns:
      Number of affected records or 0 
       
 @MapTable
 public class SimpleTable {
     public SimpleTable(){}
     public SimpleTable(String name){
         this.myName = name;
     }
     @MapPrimaryKey
     public long id;
     @MapColumnName("name")
     public String myName;
 }
 ISession session=Configure.getSession();
 session.insert(new SimpleTable("name"));
 session.updateRows(SimpleTable.class,new PairColumnValue().put("myName","newName"),null);

      public <T> T firstOrDefault(@NonNull Class<T> aClass, String where, Object... objects)
      Description copied from interface: ISession
      Gets the first value based on a condition; if it doesn't exist, returns null.
      Specified by:
      firstOrDefault in interface ISession
      Type Parameters:
      T - The generic type must represent a class marked with the annotation @MapTable or @MapTableName
      Parameters:
      aClass - Instances of the represent classes and interfaces in a running Java application. This class must be annotated with the @MapTable or @MapTableName annotation, have a public parameterless constructor, and a public field marked with the primary key annotation.
      where - A fragment of a SQL query script from a condition, where the condition, the word where, need not be written, string parameters are replaced with the parameter substitution character `?`, and parameter values are entered into the object collection in the order they appear in the query.
      objects - A collection of objects that replace the `?` symbols in a script, the order of the objects matches the order of the `?` symbols.
      Returns:
      object of type T or null 
       
 @MapTable
 public class SimpleTable {
     public SimpleTable(){}
     public SimpleTable(String name){
         this.myName = name;
     }
     @MapPrimaryKey
     public long id;
     @MapColumnName("name")
     public String myName;
 }
 ISession session=Configure.getSession();
 session.insert(new SimpleTable("name"));
 var o=session.firstOrDefault(SimpleTable.class,"name not null");
 o.myName="newName";
 var res=session.update(o);

    • single

      public <T> T single(@NonNull Class<T> aClass, String where, Object... objects) throws Exception
      Description copied from interface: ISession
      Gets a single object based on a condition. If the condition is not met: the object is not found, or there is more than one, an exception is thrown.
      Specified by:
      single in interface ISession
      Type Parameters:
      T - The generic type must represent a class marked with the annotation @MapTable or @MapTableName
      Parameters:
      aClass - Instances of the represent classes and interfaces in a running Java application. This class must be annotated with the @MapTable or @MapTableName annotation, have a public parameterless constructor, and a public field marked with the primary key annotation.
      where - A fragment of a SQL query script from a condition, where the condition, the word where, need not be written, string parameters are replaced with the parameter substitution character `?`, and parameter values are entered into the object collection in the order they appear in the query.
      objects - A collection of objects that replace the `?` symbols in a script, the order of the objects matches the order of the `?` symbols.
      Returns:
      objects or Exception
      Throws:
      Exception - 
       
 @MapTable

         this.myName = name;
     }

     public long id;
     @MapColumnName("name")
     public String myName;
 }
 ISession session=Configure.getSession();
 try {
   SimpleTable  res=session.single(SimpleTable.class,"id=10");
   // or session.single(SimpleTable.class,"id=?",10);
 } catch (Exception e) {}

    • getListSelect

      public <T, D> List<D> getListSelect(@NonNull Class<T> aClass, @NonNull String columnName, String where, Object... objects)
      Description copied from interface: ISession
      Getting a list of values for one field of a database table
      Specified by:
      getListSelect in interface ISession
      Type Parameters:
      T - The generic type must represent a class marked with the annotation @MapTable or @MapTableName
      D - any type
      Parameters:
      aClass - Instances of the represent classes and interfaces in a running Java application. This class
      columnName - The name of the field in the table by which the selection is made
      where - A fragment of a SQL query script from a condition, where the condition, the word where, need not be written, string parameters are replaced with the parameter substitution character `?`, and parameter values are entered into the object collection in the order they appear in the query.
      objects - A collection of objects that replace the `?` symbols in a script, the order of the objects matches the order of the `?` symbols.
      Returns:
      List objects any types 
       
 @MapTable
 public class SimpleTable {
     public SimpleTable(){}
     public SimpleTable(String name){
         this.myName = name;
     }
     @MapPrimaryKey
     public long id;
     @MapColumnName("name")
     public String myName;
 }
 ISession session=Configure.getSession();
 List<String>  res=session.getListSelect(SimpleTable.class,"name","name not null");

    • cursorIterator

      public <T> void cursorIterator(@NonNull Class<T> aClass, android.database.Cursor cursor, IAction<T> function)
      Description copied from interface: ISession
      An iterator for traversing a Cursor with a callback function
      Specified by:
      cursorIterator in interface ISession
      Type Parameters:
      T - The generic type must represent a class marked with the annotation @MapTable or @MapTableName 
       

 @MapTable
 public class SimpleTable {
     public SimpleTable(){}
     public SimpleTable(String name){
         this.myName = name;
     }
     @MapPrimaryKey
     public long id;
     @MapColumnName("name")
     public String myName;
 }
 ISession session=Configure.getSession();
 var cursor=session.execSQLRaw("select "name" from "+session.getTableName(SimpleTable.class));
 List<String> stringList=new ArrayList<>();
 session.cursorIterator(SimpleTable.class,cursor,o -> {
   stringList.add(o.name);
 });
      Parameters:
      aClass - Instances of the represent classes and interfaces in a running Java application. This class must be annotated with the @MapTable or @MapTableName annotation, have a public parameterless constructor, and a public field marked with the primary key annotation.
      cursor - @see Cursor
      function - lambda realisation IAction

      Returns:
      result map, key is the grouping value, value is the list of objects in which this value occurs

    • execSQLRawMap

      public List<Map<String,Object>> execSQLRawMap(@NonNull String sql, Object... objects)
      Description copied from interface: ISession
      Obtaining the resulting sample based on a condition
      Specified by:
      execSQLRawMap in interface ISession
      Parameters:
      sql - SQL script in raw form, the ability to change values with the ? symbol, the observed values must be written to the object parameter, in the order in which they are written in the script.
      objects - A collection of objects that replace the `?` symbols in a script, the order of the objects matches the order of the `?` symbols.
      Returns:
      Dictionary: table column name - column value 
       
 @MapTable
 public class SimpleTable {
     public SimpleTable(){}
     public SimpleTable(String name){
         this.myName = name;
     }
     @MapPrimaryKey
     public long id;
     @MapColumnName("name")
     public String myName;
 }
 ISession session=Configure.getSession();
 List<Map<String,Object>> res= execSQLRawMap("select mame,id from "+ session.getTableName(SimpleTable.class));
 res.forEach(row -> {
  Log.I("---",row.get("name"));
  Log.I("---",row.get("id"));
 });

    • deleteRows

      public <T> int deleteRows(@NonNull Class<T> aClass)
      Description copied from interface: ISession
      Deletes all rows from a table
      Specified by:
      deleteRows in interface ISession
      Type Parameters:
      T - The generic type must represent a class marked with the annotation @MapTable or @MapTableName
      Parameters:
      aClass - Instances of the represent classes and interfaces in a running Java application. This class must be annotated with the @MapTable or @MapTableName annotation, have a public parameterless constructor, and a public field marked with the primary key annotation.
      Returns:
      Number of affected records or 0 
       
 ISession session=Configure.getSession();
 for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
    session.insert(new SimpleTable("name:"+i);
 }
 var res=session.deleteRows(SimpleTable.class));
 // delete all rows
 assertEquals(10,res);
 var list=session.getList(SimpleTable.class);
 assertEquals(0,list.size());

    session.insert(new SimpleTable("name:"+i);
 }

 // delete rows only where name not null
 assertEquals(10,res);
 var list=session.getList(SimpleTable.class);
 assertEquals(0,list.size());

    • beginTransaction

      public void beginTransaction()
      Description copied from interface: ISession
      Begins a transaction in EXCLUSIVE mode. 
       
 ISession session=Configure.getSession();
 session.deleteRows(MyTable.class);
 session.beginTransaction();
 try {
     for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
         session.insert(factoryTable());
     }
     session.commitTransaction();
 }catch (Exception e){}
 finally {
     session.endTransaction();
 }
 var res=session.count(MyTable.class);
 assertEquals(10,res);
      Specified by:
      beginTransaction in interface ISession

    • commitTransaction

      public void commitTransaction()
      Description copied from interface: ISession
      Marks the current transaction as successful. Do not do any more database work between calling this and calling endTransaction. Do as little non-database work as possible in that situation too. If any errors are encountered between this and endTransaction the transaction will still be committed. 
       
 ISession session=Configure.getSession();
 session.deleteRows(MyTable.class);
 session.beginTransaction();
 try {
     for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
         session.insert(factoryTable());
     }
     session.commitTransaction();
 }catch (Exception e){}
 finally {
     session.endTransaction();
 }
 var res=session.count(MyTable.class);
 assertEquals(10,res);
      Specified by:
      commitTransaction in interface ISession
